TEXT: The applicant , born in DATE , presently resides in GPE , GPE . In his application form , he states that he has NORP nationality .

On DATE the applicant arrived in GPE . He requested asylum DATE . He stated that he is an ethnic NORP from NORP in GPE . As from DATE he served in the NORP army . In DATE he was taken prisoner by NORP troops and held in captivity for DATE . In DATE Kakanj was occupied by NORP troops who started an ethnic cleansing of the village . In DATE he deserted from his military unit and travelled to PERSON where he joined another unit . In DATE he absconded also from that unit and left for GPE . He arrived in GPE via GPE . During his journey he used his NORP passport which he tore apart upon arrival in GPE . The applicant claimed to be a citizen of GPE only . He feared that , if deported to GPE , he would be sent back to GPE .

On DATE ORG ( ORG invandrarverk ) rejected the applicant 's request and ordered his deportation to GPE . Finding that the applicant held both NORP and NORP citizenship , the ORG referred to a decision concerning asylum seekers with such double nationality taken by ORG on DATE . According to the decision , the prevailing situation in GPE rendered deportations to that country impossible . Consequently , in assessing applications from these asylum seekers , the crucial question was whether they could be afforded protection in GPE . ORG noted that , according to available information , there was no reason to assume that GPE would not afford the applicant protection . Further , persons in the applicant 's situation did not risk to be sent from GPE to GPE against their will . Neither was there any risk that NORP citizens in general would be forced to take part in armed conflict . Moreover , the applicant had failed to show that he would risk persecution or other harassment if deported to GPE .

The applicant appealed to ORG ( Utlänningsnämnden ) . On DATE ORG granted the applicant a temporary residence permit until DATE and quashed the deportation order . In so doing , the ORG referred to a Government decision of CARDINAL DATE according to which the worsened situation in GPE constituted an impediment to the deportation of asylum seekers to that country .

On DATE the applicant submitted a new application for a residence permit . He referred to his previous statements and added that , being an ethnic NORP , he could not return to the NORP - dominated Kakanj or to any other part of GPE . He risked punishment for having deserted from the NORP army . Moreover , he could not go to GPE where he had no place to live . His NORP passport did not entitle him to full civic rights in GPE and he would thus be forced to return to GPE .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's new application and ordered his deportation to GPE . ORG had regard to guiding decisions taken by ORG and found that the applicant should not be sent back to PERSON . With regard to the possible deportation to GPE , the ORG noted that no circumstances had been invoked by the applicant which could lead to the conclusion that he was unable to go to GPE . Consequently , ORG reiterated the conclusions drawn in its previous decision concerning the applicant . Furthermore , ORG found that there were no reasons of a humanitarian nature to grant the applicant a residence permit .
On DATE ORG upheld ORG decision .

In medical certificates issued by the psychiatric clinic at the hospital in GPE on DATE and DATE physicians ORG and ORG stated that the applicant suffered from anxiety and suicide thoughts . He had been treated with antidepressant medication . As from DATE he had been treated at the clinic for a post - traumatic stress syndrome . ORG found that the applicant was in need of qualified psychiatric care and that there was a considerable risk that he would commit self - destructive acts . The clinic submitted the certificate of DATE to ORG and requested that the enforcement of the deportation order be suspended .
On DATE ORG decided not to suspend the enforcement of the deportation order .

Under LAW of LAW ( Lagen om psykiatrisk tvångsvård , DATE ) , such care shall be terminated at the request of the competent police authority whenever the person placed in care is ordered to be deported . This presupposes , however , that the chief physician finds that the alien 's condition allows that the deportation takes place . According to LAW , no appeal lies against the chief physician 's decision .
